title: 4 Autobiographies Of Bollywood Celebrities That Should Be On Your Bookshelf
text:
facebook 397 SHARES 
Bollywood is not all that rosy as it seems from the outside. Living the celebrity life comes with several sacrifices and hard work, which is often not talked about. Hence, when a celebrity writes a biography, giving all the information, the contents tend to grab headlines. If you are a filmy buff, and want to know more about this dream world, you should definitely grab the biographies of these superstars. Karan Johar: An Unsuitable Boy 
The man who can break and make careers in Bollywood has been one of the biggest victims of media. Many people have trolled him for being gay but that doesn't stop this successful director from being who he is (and we love him for that). He is one man who knows all the most inside scoop and gossip of the industry. Through his biography, we've come to know that his life has been no less than a roller coaster life and is a must read for all Bollywood lovers. Rishi Kapoor's Uncensored Khullam Khulla 
In Rishi Kapoor's biography, he confesses to buying an award and talks about how he was super arrogant to people when he was on top of his career. If you are looking for some juicy Bollywood gossip and secrets, this biography is all what you need. Kareena Kapoor: The Style Diary Of A Bollywood Diva 
If you are a big fan of Bebo and love her style, you had better get your hands on a copy of this book. It talks about everything from Kareena's choice of handbags to her favourite online shopping sites to how she makes her sartorial choices; this one has everything. Rekha: The Untold Story 
This book has some of the most shocking revelations about Rekha's past and acting career. The book contains several excerpts from the superstar's interviews. This book sheds light on all those stories that never got their due. It was shocking to learn that Rekha was molested on the sets of her film, as her co-actor Biswajeet Chatterjee, forcefully kissed her in a scene that she was not told about. The book also talks about her alleged affair with Amitabh Bachchan and how actor Vinod Mehra's mother refused to let Rekha enter his house. Photo Credit: BCCL
